Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Crayola named its new blue crayon "Nipsey Blue" in honor of Nipsey Hussle, when in fact, this is not true.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a junk news article from an entertainment website that carries a disclaimer stating that it publishes satire news.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the "Nipsey Blue" crayon was a real product by Crayola, when it was actually a custom label created by a visitor at a Crayola Experience location.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the social media push to have Crayola name a blue crayon in honor of Nipsey Hussle was based on a two-year-old marketing campaign and was largely wasted.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Crayola had already settled on a different name for their new blue crayon, which was "Bluetiful."
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
